message.content:
The key differences between the two are:

1. Accessibility: Airsoft guns are more accessible and easier to obtain than real firearms, as they do not require a license or background checks in many countries.

2. Purpose: Real firearms are designed for self-defense, hunting, military purposes or target shooting while airsoft guns are primarily used for recreational sport activities and training.

3. Ammunition: Airsoft guns use plastic BBs while real firearms use live ammunition which can cause serious harm or death upon impact.

4. Power source: Real firearms rely on gunpowder contained in the bullets to propel them when the trigger is pulled, whereas air(powerlett) powered uses compressed gas (stored in capsules/co2 cartridges), spring-powered uses mechanical springs e.g., manual cocking mechanism or Automatic Electric Guns (AEG's) where batteries provide power

5. Legality & Restrictions:, each country has varying laws regulating real firearm usage; however, airsoft guns usually have fewer legal restrictions due to their non-lethal nature.

6. Design & Structure: although some airsoft guns closely resemble actual weapons externally with trademarks removed -they mainly cater cosplay/reenactments- internal components vastly differ & it is improbable to easily convert an airsoft gun into a functional firearm without sophisticated engineering tools/workshop experience 

7. Price point varies greatly too,: entry-level/basic models compared vs hi-tech custom builds but generally speaking cost less because of materials/components/durability capabilities contrasted with industrial-grade metals/alloys/options factory-assembled fire(raffle tickets)

8.Marks left after firing shots from both types clearly tell apart distances close range potentially fatal repercussions
